fulfilDecryptionRequest(uint256,bytes,by.details: This function is intended to be called after a decryption key has been generated off-chain.

params.decryptionKey: The decrypted content in bytes format. The data should represent the original                      message in its decrypted form.
params.requestID: The unique identifier for the encryption request. This should match the ID used                  when the encryption was initially requested.
params.signature: The signature associated with the request, provided as a byte array

returns._0: A uint array representing a set containing all request ids with reverting callbacks.
A uint array representing a set containing all fulfilled request ids.
A uint array representing a set containing all request ids that are yet to be fulfilled.
A uint representing a count of all request ids that are yet to be fulfilled.

getPublicKey().details: Returns the public key as two elliptic curve points.

returns._0: Two pairs of coordinates representing the public key points on the elliptic curve.

getPublicKeyBytes().details: Returns the public key as bytes.

returns._0: Bytes string representing the public key points on the elliptic curve.

getRequest(uint256).details: This function returns the Request struct associated with the given requestId.

params.requestId: The ID of the request to retrieve.

returns._0: The Request struct corresponding to the given requestId.

params.requestID: The ID of the request to check.

returns._0: boolean indicating whether the request has errored or not.

params.requestID: The ID of the request to check.

returns._0: boolean indicating whether the request is in flight or not.

registerCiphertext(string,bytes,bytes).details: The creation of `Ciphertext` and `conditions` bytes will be managed by the JavaScript client library

params.ciphertext: The encrypted data to be registered
params.conditions: The conditions that need to be met to decrypt the ciphertext

returns.requestID: The unique ID assigned to the registered decryption request

retryCallback(uint256).details: This function is intended to be called after a decryption key has been generated off-chain but failed to call back into the originating contract.

params.requestID: The unique identifier for the encryption request. This should match the ID used                  when the encryption was initially requested.

params.newSignatureSchemeAddressProvider: The signature address provider address to set

version().details: Returns the version number of the upgradeable contract.

fulfilDecryptionRequest(uint256,bytes,by.notice: Provide the decryption key for a specific requestID alongside a signature.

getAllErroredRequestIds().notice: Returns all the request ids where the callback reverted but a decryption key was provided, i.e., "fulfilled" but still in flight.

getAllFulfilledRequestIds().notice: Returns all the fulfilled request ids.

getAllUnfulfilledRequestIds().notice: Returns all the request ids that are yet to be fulfilled.

getCountOfUnfulfilledRequestIds().notice: Returns count of all the request ids that are yet to be fulfilled.

getPublicKey().notice: Retrieves the public key associated with the decryption process.

getPublicKeyBytes().notice: Retrieves the public key associated with the decryption process.

getRequest(uint256).notice: Retrieves a specific request by its ID.

hasErrored(uint256).notice: returns whether a specific request errored during callback or not.

isInFlight(uint256).notice: Verifies whether a specific request is in flight or not.

registerCiphertext(string,bytes,bytes).notice: Registers a Ciphertext and associated conditions for decryptioncreation of the `Ciphertext` and `conditions` bytes will be managed by a javascript client library off-chain

retryCallback(uint256).notice: Retry an request that has previously failed during callback

setSignatureSchemeAddressProvider(addres.notice: Updates the signature scheme address provider contract address
